name: Affogato
recipe:
Pour a double shot of hot espresso into two scoops of vanilla ice cream. 

Optionally garnish with shaved dark chocolate and chopped hazelnuts.

name: Caffè Americano
recipe:
To a double shot of espresso, add hot water. 

The espresso to water ratio should be approximately 1:2 or 1:3 if you prefer a smoother brew.

name: Café au Lait
recipe:
In 1/2 cup of French pressed coffee, pour in boiling milk. 

The coffee to milk ratio should be 1:1. 

Unlike Latte, frothing the milk here is usually depreciated.

Optionally, sprinkle with cinnamon dust and enjoy hot.

name: Bicerin
ingredients: Espresso, Dark Chocolate, White Chocolate, Milk, Whipped Cream
recipe:
In 250ml of simmering milk, melt chunks of unsweetened dark chocolate and unsweetened white chocolate separately (125ml each). 

Pour in double shot espresso in transparent glass. 

Gradually add the hot dark chocolate mixture, followed by the hot white chocolate, to create three distinct layers. 

Top the drink with a swirl of sweetened whipped cream to assemble the fourth layer, and serve it hot.

name: Black Eye
recipe:
In a double shot espresso, add 115ml of brewed coffee. 

Brewed coffee can be French pressed, poured over, or extracted using drip machines. 

A  single shot of espresso will result in Red Eye Coffee, whereas a triple shot of espresso will give you a Dead Eye Coffee.

name: Breve
recipe:
To 60ml of steamed half-and-half milk, gently pour in double shot espresso. 

Top the mixture with the half-and-half foam. 

The ratio of espresso, milk, and foam should be 1:1:1.

name: Cappuccino
recipe:
To a double shot of espresso, pour equal parts of steamed milk from a 15-20cm height to mix the milk with the coffee. 

Slowly lower the height to foam the top of the cup.

The goal is to get a 1:1:1 ratio of espresso, milk, and foam

Optionally add finely grounded sugar for a sweeter brew.

name: Cappuccino Freddo
recipe:
In a shaker, add three parts heavy cream and one part steamed milk and shake until the mixture thickens. 

Add a few pieces of ice to double shot espresso and mix to chill the coffee. Pour the milk-cream mixture over the ice. 

Optionally top the drink with a swirl of whipped cream.

name: Café Con Hielo
recipe:
To a double shot of espresso, throw in a few teaspoons of sugar and mix until dissolved. 

Pour the mixture over ice cubes and enjoy it cold. 

Optionally add milk for taste.

name: Café Con Leche
recipe:
Heat or steam milk until it reaches 83°C. 

You mustn’t let the milk come to a boil. 

Then pour the milk over a single shot espresso and serve it hot.

name: Caffè Corretto
recipe:
To a single shot of espresso, pour in an equal amount of liquor of choice. 

Grappa is most commonly preferred. 

However, any brandy will work just fine.

name: Cortado
recipe:
To a single shot of espresso, pour an equal amount or less of steamed milk. 

The steamed milk here should not be too frothy. 

Top the drink with a tablespoon of milk foam and enjoy hot.

name: Caffè Crema
recipe:
In a container, whisk two teaspoons of flour, sugar, and milk together until thoroughly combined. 

To the mixture, pour in a double shot espresso and turn on the heat immediately. 

While stirring the mixture continuously, bring the mixture to a boil. 

Pour the drink into the serving cup and enjoy it hot.

name: Dry Cappuccino
recipe:
To a double shot of espresso, add equal or more milk foam on top. 

Optionally add sugar to the espresso.

name: Espresso
recipe:
To 10g of finely grounded coffee, forcefully pass 35ml of nearly boiling water with around 9-10 bars of pressure.

This brewing amount results in a single shot of espresso.

To brew a double shot, double the coffee, and water amount.

name: Espresso Con Panna
recipe:
To a double shot espresso, swirl in whipped cream. 

Optionally add sugar to espresso for a smoother brew.

name: Espresso Doppio
recipe:
To 20g of finely grounded coffee, forcefully pass 65ml of nearly boiling water with around 9-10 bars of pressure.

This brewing amount results in a double shot of espresso, also known as Espresso Doppio.

To brew a single shot, use half the coffee and water amount.

name: Espresso Laccino
recipe:
Into a double shot of espresso, throw in a few ice cubes. 
Optionally add sugar to taste.

name: Espresso Martini
ingredients: Espresso, Vodka, Sugar Syrup, Ice, Coffee Beans
recipe:
Mix 60ml of vodka, 15ml of coffee liqueur, 15ml of sugar syrup, and single-shot espresso. 

Strain the mixture in an iced glass. 

Garnish the top with three coffee beans and enjoy it cold.

name: Espresso Romano
recipe:
To a single shot of espresso, squeeze or drop a slice of lemon.

Optionally add half a tablespoon of sugar to taste.

Garnish with a lemon wedge and enjoy hot or cold.

name: Flat White
recipe:
In a single shot espresso, pour in double the amount of frothed milk. 

Optionally add sugar to taste.

name: Café Frappé
recipe:
To a single shot espresso, add a few cubes of ice. 

Add cold, steamed milk and top with whipped cream. 

Optionally beat the milk with ice cream and add the syrup of choice.

name: Freddo Espresso
recipe:
In a blender, blend ice cubes with a double shot of espresso until the mixture thickens. 

Strain the mixture and garnish with ice. 

Optionally add maple syrup for a sweeter brew.

name: Galão
recipe:
To a single shot of espresso, pour triple the amount of foamed milk. 

Optionally add sugar for a sweeter brew and garnish with cocoa dust.

Serve the drink hot.

name: Café Glacé
recipe:
In a blender, blend ice cream with a double shot of espresso. 

Strain in a tall glass and serve it cold with ice cubes.

name: Irish Coffee
ingredients: Espresso, Irish Whiskey, Whipped Cream, Brown Sugar
recipe:
In a tall glass, add two tablespoons of brown sugar. 

Add 45ml of Irish Whiskey followed by two double shots of espresso (120ml) and stir until combined. 

Slowly pour the whipped cream over the top of the drink.

name: Latte
recipe:
To a double shot of espresso, pour equal parts of steamed milk from a 15-20cm height to mix the milk with the coffee. 

Slowly lower the height to art the top of the cup with the foam-coffee mixture. 

The goal is to get a 2:3 ratio of espresso and milk. 

Optionally add finely grounded sugar for a sweeter brew.

name: Latte Macchiato
recipe:
Pour steamed milk into a tall glass. 

Gently pour a single shot of espresso, creating a second layer on top of the milk. 

Top the drink with milk foam, and you’ll have a three-layered brew.

name: Lungo
recipe:
To 10g of finely grounded coffee, forcefully pass 65ml of nearly boiling water with around 9-10 bars of pressure. 

This drink will take a little longer to brew than a regular espresso. 

As a result, you will get a milder version of an espresso.

name: Caffè Macchiato
recipe: To a single shot of espresso, add a dot of milk foam on top and enjoy hot.

name: Marocchino
recipe:
To a single shot of espresso, sprinkle some cocoa dust. 

Pour milk foam over the coffee. 

Optionally sprinkle some cocoa dust over the foam to garnish.

name: Mead Raf
recipe:
To a single shot of espresso, pour in one tablespoon of honey. 

Stir well until combined. 

Top the drink with whipped cream and optionally garnish with drizzles of honey.

name: Caffè Mocha
recipe:
To a double shot of espresso, pour an equal amount of chocolate sauce. 

Into the mixture, pour ¾ cup of steamed milk. 

Optionally garnish with whipped cream, cocoa powder, cinnamon sticks, or/and burnt marshmallows for a sweet dessert.

name: Mocha Breve
recipe:
Into a double shot espresso, shower drizzles of chocolate syrup. 

Stir the mixture until combined. 

Top the mixture with half-and-half milk. 

The goal is to get a 1:1:1 ratio of espresso, chocolate, and milk. 

Optionally garnish the drink with caramel and enjoy it hot.

name: Café Noisette
recipe:
Into a double shot espresso, pour 30ml of hot cream. 

Optionally garnish with cocoa dust and add sugar as per the choice.

name: Piccolo Latte
recipe:
Into a single shot of espresso, add 60ml of frothed milk. 

Top the drink with light milk foam. 

The goal is to get a higher value in espresso to milk ratio.

name: Raf Coffee
recipe:
In a pitcher, place three tablespoons of vanilla sugar, 120ml of cream, and a single shot of espresso. 

Mix the ingredients and steam the pitcher until you obtain an ice-cream-like texture. 

Pour in a cup and serve it hot.

name: Ristretto
recipe:
To 10g of finely grounded coffee, forcefully pass 20ml of nearly boiling water with around 9-10 bars of pressure. 

It gives a highly concentrated espresso, also known as Ristretto.

name: Syrup Latte
recipe:
To a single shot of espresso, add any syrup of choice. 

Mix well until homogeneous. 

To the mixture, pour in frothed milk. Optionally garnish with the syrup on top.

name: Vienna Coffee
recipe:
To a double shot of espresso, add whipped cream. 

Optionally add honey or cocoa powder for a sweeter brew.
